poem:
Title: Blazing Bits of Starlight 

Moonlight now muted, caught in a dazzle dance,
Splintered suns in sudden advance. 
Lament the drivers, bedazzled, besought,
By halogen whispers and LED thought.

In their rancour, a government springs,
Tows daylight from darkness, on chrome-plated wings. 
Yet in the quiet, the road hums a hymn,
Counting on shadows, when headlines grow dim.
